fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`MOVSX r16, r/m8`
`MOVSX r32, r/m8`
`MOVSX r64, r/m8`
`MOVSX r32, r/m16`
`MOVSX r64, r/m16`
`MOVSXD r16, r/m16`
`MOVSXD r32, r/m32`
`MOVSXD r64, r/m32`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Copies the contents of the source operand (register or memory location) to the destination operand (register) and sign extends the value to 16 or 32 bits (see Figure 7-6 in the Intel® 64 and IA-32 Architectures Software Developer’s Manual, Volume 1). The size of the converted value depends on the operand-size attribute.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: In 64-bit mode, the instruction’s default operation size is 32 bits. Use of the REX.R prefix permits access to additional registers (R8-R15). Use of the REX.W prefix promotes operation to 64 bits. See the summary chart at the beginning of this section for encoding data and limits.
